document.docAuthor: Xue, Dayong, Cui, Le & Jiang, Nan
document.masterDocTitle: A review of Problepsis Lederer, 1853 (Lepidoptera: Geometridae) from China, with description of two new species

mods:titleInfo.mods:title: A review of Problepsis Lederer, 1853 (Lepidoptera: Geometridae) from China, with description of two new species

paragraph.materialsCitation:
Problepsis eucircota Prout, 1913
, in Seitz, Macrolepid. World , 4: 50, pl. 7: b. Syntypes
5 ♂
, 2♀ , China : Shanghai ; Ningpo ; Chia-ting-fu ( NHM ).

subSubSection.paragraph:
Diagnosis. The species is similar to
P. stueningi
sp. nov .
, but can be distinguished by the following characters: the female antenna is dentate, while in
P. stueningi
sp. nov .
, it is filiform; the postmedial line of the forewing is slightly incurved between M veins, while it is smooth in
P. stueningi
sp. nov .
; the ocellus on the underside of the forewing is densely diffused with dark greyish brown scales, and the two black markings are invisible, while in
P. stueningi
sp. nov .
, it shows through faintly from the upperside, without any greyish brown scales, and the black markings are invisible; in the male genitalia, the outer margin of the valvula is smooth, but it is triangular in
P. stueningi
sp. nov .
, the aedeagus is stouter and shorter, the lateral projections of the male eighth sternite are almost quadrate, but it is rounded in
P. stueningi
sp. nov .
; in the female genitalia, the sclerite on the dorsal side of the anterior part of the ductus bursae is triangular, but it is trapeziform in
P. stueningi
sp. nov .
